remarks: Obsolete version of ~ df-mnd as of 6-Feb-2020.  Definition of a monoid. A monoid is a set equipped with an everywhere defined internal operation (so, a magma, see ~ mndcl ), whose operation is associative (so, a semigroup, see ~ mndass ) and has a two-sided neutral element (see ~ mndid ).  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Jan-2015.) (New usage is discouraged.)
